quote: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
author: William Blake

quote: Think before you speak. Read before you think.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: Knowledge without wisdom is a load of books on the back of an ass.
author: Japanese Proverb

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Action should culminate in wisdom.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: This age thinks better of a gilded fool Than of a threadbare saint in wisdom's school.
author: Thomas Dekker

quote: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.
author: Archimedes

quote: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal, and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.
author: Charles Spurgeon

quote: It is human nature to think wisely and act foolishly.
author: Anatole France

quote: Even though you know a thousand things, ask the man who knows one.
author: Proverbs

quote: When you move amidst the world of sense, free from attachment and aversion alike, there comes the peace in which all sorrows end, and you life in the wisdom of the Self.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: He who lives by the crystal ball soon learns to eat ground glass.
author: Edgar R. Fiedler

quote: Wisdom is knowledge, rightly applied.
author: Hyrum W. Smith

quote: It is impossible to love and to be wise.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A monarchy conducted with infinite wisdom and infinite benevolence is the most perfect of all possible governments.
author: Ezra Stiles

quote: Let us not take ourselves too seriously. None of us has a monopoly on wisdom.
author: Queen Elizabeth

quote: The sage has one advantage: He is immortal. If this is not his century, many others will be.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: The pine stays green in winter... wisdom in hardship.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: A wise man never knows all, only fools know everything
author: African Proverbs

quote: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy ax without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
author: Doug Larson

quote: Be happy. It's one way of being wise.
author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

quote: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Never let a fool kiss you, or a kiss fool you.
author: Joey Adams

quote: The man who makes everything that leads to happiness depends upon himself, and not upon other men, has adopted the very best plan for living happily. This is the man of moderation, the man of manly character and of wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: Behold, my son, with what little wisdom the world is ruled.
author: Count Axel Gustafsson Oxenstierna

quote: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: Who is a wise man? He who learns of all men.
author: The Talmud

quote: Don't taunt the alligator until after you've crossed the creek.
author: Dan Rather

quote: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Wisdom outweighs any wealth.
author: Sophocles

quote: Rich people without wisdom and learning are but sheep with golden fleeces.
author: Solon

quote: The height of human wisdom is to bring our tempers down to our circumstances, and to make a calm within, under the weight of the greatest storm without.
author: Daniel Defoe

quote: Wise men learn more from fools than fools from the wise.
author: Cato The Elder

quote: Be wisely worldly, but not worldly wise.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: Just as a fire is covered by smoke and a mirror is obscured by dust, just as the embryo rests deep within the womb, wisdom is hidden by selfish desire.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom.
author: Elizabeth Gaskell

quote: Knowledge without wisdom is double folly.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
author: Epicurus

quote: As long as there are slaughterhouses there will be battlefields.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Wisdom is nothing more than healed pain.
author: General Robert E. Lee

quote: Wisdom is found only in truth.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: I AM IGNORANT of absolute truth. But I am humble before my ignorance and therein lies my honor and my reward.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can never live long enough to make them all yourself.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: The wise man avoids evil by anticipating it.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: I acknowledge the privilege of being alive in a human body at this moment, endowed with senses, memories, emotions, thoughts, and the space of mind in its wisdom aspect.
author: Alex Grey

quote: when man determined to destroy    himself he picked the was    of shall and finding only why    smashed it into because.
author: E.E. Cummings

quote: Wisdom is meaningless until our own experience has given it meaning.
author: Bergen Evans

quote: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: Wise kings generally have wise counselors; and he must be a wise man himself who is capable of distinguishing one.
author: Diogenes

quote: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: So wise so young, they say, do never live long.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Every man, however wise, needs the advice of some sagacious friend in the affairs of life.
author: Plautus

quote: As irrigators lead water where they want, as archers make their arrows straight, as carpenters carve wood, the wise shape their minds.
author: Buddha

quote: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another.
author: Juvenal

quote: Start wide, expand further, and never look back.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: Man is only great when he acts from passion.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Time ripens all things; no man is born wise.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Wisdom is like electricity. There is no permanently wise man, but men capable of wisdom, who, being put into certain company, or other favorable conditions, become wise for a short time, as glasses rubbed acquire electric power for a while.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: True wisdom lies in gathering the precious things out of each day as it goes by.
author: E. S. Bouton

quote: The heart of the wise man lies quiet like limpid water.
author: Proverbs

quote: Ninety percent of all human wisdom is the ability to mind your own business.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Very few men are wise by their own counsel, or learned by their own teaching; for he that was only taught by himself had a fool as his master.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
author: Sophocles

quote: I do not believe in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Much wisdom often goes with fewer words.
author: Sophocles

quote: I do not think much of a man who is not wiser today than he was yesterday.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The tigers of wrath are wiser than the horses of instruction.
author: William Blake

quote: From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: My aim, then, was to whip the rebels, to humble their pride, to follow them to their inmost recesses, and make them fear and dread us. Fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: Repeat anything often enough and it will start to become you.
author: Tom Hopkins

quote: True wisdom is less presuming than folly. The wise man doubteth often, and changeth his mind; the fool is obstinate, and doubteth not; he knoweth all things but his own ignorance.
author: Akhenaton

quote: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: If the highest things are unknowable, then the highest capacity or virtue of man cannot be theoretical wisdom.
author: Leo Strauss

quote: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
author: Alexander Dumas

quote: Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: As far as feeling freedom in my career now versus five years ago... I think if I feel any more free it's simply because of the experiences that I've had, and the wisdom I've accumulated from that time.
author: Mary Chapin Carpenter

quote: Wisdom makes but a slow defense against trouble, though at last a sure one.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: A man may learn wisdom even from a foe.
author: Aristophanes

quote: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom; and with all your getting get understanding.
author: Bible

quote: The wisest man is he who does not fancy that he is so at all.
author: Nicholas Boileau

quote: For all my education, accomplishments, and so called 'wisdom'... I can't fathom my own heart.
author: Michael Caine

quote: Wisdom in a poor man is a diamond set in lead.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: I'm not wise, but the beginning of wisdom is there; it's like relaxing into - and an acceptance of - things.
author: Tina Turner

quote: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Socrates

quote: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
author: William Cowper

quote: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The wisest have the most authority.
author: Plato

quote: The wise man avoids evil by anticipating it.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: I acknowledge the privilege of being alive in a human body at this moment, endowed with senses, memories, emotions, thoughts, and the space of mind in its wisdom aspect.
author: Alex Grey

quote: Wisdom is like electricity. There is no permanently wise man, but men capable of wisdom, who, being put into certain company, or other favorable conditions, become wise for a short time, as glasses rubbed acquire electric power for a while.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: True wisdom lies in gathering the precious things out of each day as it goes by.
author: E. S. Bouton

quote: The heart of the wise man lies quiet like limpid water.
author: Proverbs

quote: Ninety percent of all human wisdom is the ability to mind your own business.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Very few men are wise by their own counsel, or learned by their own teaching; for he that was only taught by himself had a fool as his master.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
author: Sophocles

quote: I do not believe in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Much wisdom often goes with fewer words.
author: Sophocles

quote: I do not think much of a man who is not wiser today than he was yesterday.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The tigers of wrath are wiser than the horses of instruction.
author: William Blake

quote: From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: My aim, then, was to whip the rebels, to humble their pride, to follow them to their inmost recesses, and make them fear and dread us. Fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: Repeat anything often enough and it will start to become you.
author: Tom Hopkins

quote: True wisdom is less presuming than folly. The wise man doubteth often, and changeth his mind; the fool is obstinate, and doubteth not; he knoweth all things but his own ignorance.
author: Akhenaton

quote: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: If the highest things are unknowable, then the highest capacity or virtue of man cannot be theoretical wisdom.
author: Leo Strauss

quote: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
author: Alexander Dumas

quote: Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: As far as feeling freedom in my career now versus five years ago... I think if I feel any more free it's simply because of the experiences that I've had, and the wisdom I've accumulated from that time.
author: Mary Chapin Carpenter

quote: Wisdom makes but a slow defense against trouble, though at last a sure one.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: A man may learn wisdom even from a foe.
author: Aristophanes

quote: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom; and with all your getting get understanding.
author: Bible

quote: The wisest man is he who does not fancy that he is so at all.
author: Nicholas Boileau

quote: For all my education, accomplishments, and so called 'wisdom'... I can't fathom my own heart.
author: Michael Caine

quote: Wisdom in a poor man is a diamond set in lead.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: I'm not wise, but the beginning of wisdom is there; it's like relaxing into - and an acceptance of - things.
author: Tina Turner

quote: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Socrates

quote: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
author: William Cowper

quote: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The wisest have the most authority.
author: Plato
